descriptions.title: Description
descriptions.body: Instruct the Flex to send a command from a project library to a project device. action = IR x, y "Device Name" "Command Name". x is the IR Port Number. y is the number of times to repeat the command. Device name is the EXACT name given to the device in the project. Command Name is the EXACT name given to the desired command in the project.

descriptions.title: Description
descriptions.body: Instruct the Flex to send a command from a project library to a project device. action = SER x "Device Name" "Command Name". x is the Serial Port Number. Device name is the EXACT name given to the device in the project. Command Name is the EXACT name given to the desired command in the project.

descriptions.title: Description
descriptions.body: Instructs the Flex to change to a specified screen called a desktop. Action = GoTo x. x is the number of the desktop to display. You can determine the number for a particular desktop by looking at the Define Screens – Build Screen List tab in the Configuration Utility. Splash is desktop 0 and Home is desktop 1.

descriptions.title: Description
descriptions.body: Instructs the Flex to pause execution for a specified amount of time. action = WAIT x. x is a value in milliseconds to wait. 100 <= x => 60000. 1 Second = 1000 milliseconds.

descriptions.title: Description
descriptions.body: Performs a virtual press of the specified button. action = VPRESS Desktop x Button y. x is the number of the desktop containing the button to press. y is the number of the Button or Source to press. The Button / Source number can be determined from the Define Screens – Assign Button Actions tab in the CU. Select the screen containing the button to press and then select the button. Beside the graphic of the button is the designator for that button.

descriptions.title: Description
descriptions.body: Performs a virtual press of the specified button. action = VPRESS Desktop x Button y. x is the number of the desktop containing the button to press. y is the number of the Button or Source to press. The Button / Source number can be determined from the Define Screens – Assign Button Actions tab in the CU. Select the screen containing the button to press and then select the button. Beside the graphic of the button is the designator for that button.

descriptions.title: Description
descriptions.body: Set the state of a toggle button to a specific value. action = SET STATE x Desktop y Button /Source z. x is the state (0 or 1). y is the Desktop Number. z is the Button/Source Number

descriptions.title: Description
descriptions.body: Sends a serial command to a device connected to the Flex. action = SER x INLINE “Serial Command”. x is the number of the serial port. Serial Command is the serial command to send to the device. Note: Catch Connect cannot insert hex characters in the Serial Command.

descriptions.title: Description
descriptions.body: Register an event in the Flex’s log. action = LOG ‘Event Type’ ‘Event Name’. Event Type is the type of Event that is occurring such as Source Change. Event Name is the specific event that occurs such as DVD.

descriptions.title: Description
descriptions.body: Instructs the Flex to ignore all screen touches for a specified amount of time. action = TOUCH LOCKOUT x. x is the amount of time to lock the screen in milliseconds. 100<=x=>360000000. 1 Second = 1000 Milliseconds.
